intro: Pentace strychnoidea, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that has been used traditionally for various purposes, including as a source of latex. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverine forests. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
